titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A bright day but very cold, the wind cutting.
prints my letter on its front page under the heading '
The faith of the Sovereign' Catholic Allegiance to Elizabeth. Reply to Cardinal Bourne
.' It reads better than I expected, though whether it was worth while writing it I doubt.

Lionel & I motored to Durham, where I instituted and licenced 8 clergymen in the Castle, and then lunched with Wilson. Then I had an interview in the Chapter Office with Probert from Winlaton. When he had gone, I was photographed by Edis. Then we motored to Deaf Hill, where I confirmed 60 candidates. We had tea with Wilkinson, the Vicar of Chilton: after which I confirmed a sick woman privately. Then we went to Lomax's largest church, an exâ€“skating rink, where I confirmed 175 persons in a stifling atmosphere. After the service we returned to Auckland.
The Prime Minister sends me a civilly expressed refusal of my request that he should speak for the Castle Fund at the Mansion House Meeting. I wrote to Lord Grey asking him to do so.
Moore Ede lunched at the Castle, in my absence.
